intro: Barneoudia major var. patagonica, commonly known as the Patagonian barneoudia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers that bloom in the spring. It is adapted to survive in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open grasslands and shrublands. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
